Strengthening the Capacity for Environmental and Climate Change Laws  
in Asia and the Pacific (KSTA REG 51310) 
 
 
TERMS OF REFERENCE FOR CONSULTANTS 
 
A.  Scope of Work 
 
1.  The TA will strengthen the  capacity and networks of university-level educators and 
institutions to improve the teaching and application of environment and climate change laws in 
ADB’s  developing  member  countries  (DMCs),  leading  to  more  effective  implementation, 
compliance  and  enforcement  of  national  laws  and  better  implementation  of  international 
commitments such as the Paris Agreement and Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). The TA 
will: (i) improve the quality of teaching of environmental laws and emerging climate change laws 
through  in-person  train-the-trainers  (TTT)  programs  comprising  an  overview  of  the  core 
substantive  elements  of  environmental  and  emerging  climate  change  laws  and  teaching 
methodologies to enhance student learning and interest; (ii) expand national, subregional and 
regional networks by convening national, sub-regional and regional in-person and e-roundtables 
to foster knowledge-sharing and collaboration within and among the DMCs; and (iii) enhance the 
knowledge platform to increase national and regional expertise in environmental and climate 
change laws and sustainable development issues. 
 
2.  The TA will require a total of 12 person-months of individual consulting inputs allocated as 
follows: (i) 3 person-months of international consultants and (ii) 9 person-months of national 
consultants.  ADB  may  engage  resource  persons  as  necessary.  Individual  consultants  and 
resource persons will be recruited using individually in accordance ADB’s Procurement Policy 
(2017, as amended from time to time) and the associated PAIs/TA Staff Instructions. 
 
B.  International Consultants  
 
3.  E-learning  Course  Development  Consultant  (international,  1.5  person-months, 
intermittent)  
 
4.         Scope of Work. The e-learning course development consultant will be responsible for the 
design, development and delivery of at least one multimedia e-learning course to complement the 
TTT in-person training programs, allowing TTT participants to gain further instruction on key 
substantive topics in environment and/or climate change laws relevant to the region. Although the 
e-learning course will be designed for TTT participants, other interested parties from ADB’s DMCs 
can gain access to the e-learning course. The content, structure and number of modules of the 
e-learning course will be designed based on the needs of the relevant TTT participants and based 
on consultation with ADB counsel and relevant members of the TA team.  
  
5.         Detailed Tasks. Under the supervision of ADB TA counsel, the consultant is expected to 
undertake the following tasks: 
  
(i)  conduct research and needs assessment for the design and development of the 
multimedia e-learning course, including consultations with TTT participants, ADB 
TA counsel, knowledge partner and relevant members of the TA team, factoring in 
geographic locations of learners (i.e., cultural issues, network bandwidth, whether 
synchronous learning is possible in time zones), as well as targeting learners’ 
previous knowledge, technical expertise and computer capabilities and skills; 
(ii)  write module learning outcomes, defining module structure and sequencing and 
developing evaluation strategies;

2 
 
(iii)  create subject materials, developing any custom media (i.e., video, animation, 
quizzes,  interactive  learning  activities,  etc.)  and  storyboard  to  integrate  all 
instructional methods; 
(iv)  consider copyright considerations and any accessibility issues; 
(v)  devise learner feedback tools and implement and seek technical and instructional 
design reviews; 
(vi)  conduct evaluation on the e-learning course and provide feedback to ADB TA 
counsel and relevant members of the TA team;  
(vii)  assess further demand for other e-learning courses; and 
(viii)  perform other reasonably related tasks to achieve TA outputs and outcomes.  
 
1.  Qualifications. The E-learning Course Development Consultant must: 
 
(i)  be a university-level instructor or professor of environmental and/or climate change 
laws with at least 8 years of teaching experience; 
(ii)  have at least three years of experience in designing and developing multimedia e-
learning products for distance learning in the area of environmental and/or climate 
change laws; 
(iii)  have a PhD in law or related discipline;  
(iv)  have an excellent command of the English language; and 
(v)  experience working and/or teaching in ADB’s DMCs is preferred.   
 
7.  Knowledge Management and Communications Consultant (international, 1.5 person-
months, intermittent)  
 
8.  Scope  of  Work. The  consultant  will  be  responsible  for  the  development  and 
implementation  of  the knowledge  and  communications  plan  to  provide  a  framework  for 
communicating and sharing of knowledge generated from the TTT programs and national and 
regional roundtables, manage the production of demand-driven knowledge products, manage 
communications with TTT participants and other relevant stakeholders and assist in building and 
fostering national and regional networks. 
 
9.  Detailed Tasks. Under the supervision of ADB TA counsel, the consultant is expected to 
undertake the following tasks:  
 
(i)  prepare the knowledge and communications plan for ADB TA counsel approval 
and support implementation of the plan’s activities; 
(ii)  consult with ADB TA counsel, knowledge partner, TTT participants, and other key 
stakeholders  on  the  production,  publication,  and  delivery  of  demand-driven 
knowledge products and make relevant recommendations; 
(iii)  provide overall communications and knowledge management support for the in-
person trainings and national and regional roundtables, including attending and 
making presentations on knowledge products, as deemed necessary by ADB TA 
counsel; 
(iv)  work closely with the Web and Multimedia Specialist in tracking and monitoring the 
results and impact of the TA website and knowledge products and report on their 
effective  value  and  impact  and  make  recommendation  for  continual 
improvements;  
(v)  work closely with the E-learning Course Development Consultant and ADB’s 
Department  of  External  Communications  on  the  delivery  of  the  e-learning 
courseware;

3 
 
(vi)  work with TTT participants on creating, establishing and/or maintaining networks 
and maintaining and promoting continual dialogue with the TTT participants and 
providing feedback to ADB TA counsel, knowledge partner and TA team;  
(vii)  design and provide TA project communications to TTT participants (including e-
newsletters) and provide regular updates to the knowledge partner, TA consultants 
and other stakeholders and external partners, on various TA activities, events and 
knowledge products; and 
(viii)  perform other reasonably related tasks to achieve TA outputs and outcomes. 
 
10.  Qualifications. The Knowledge Management and Communications Consultant must have: 
 
(i)  at least 8 years of experience in print, video and/or multimedia publications; 
(ii)  demonstrated experience in communications, knowledge management, video and 
graphic development and editing, proofreading, and copy editing; and knowledge 
in social media management; 
(iii)  a degree or work experience in knowledge production and/or communication, or 
its equivalent; 
(iv)  excellent verbal and written communication skills, and demonstrated experience 
working with a variety of stakeholders, editors, consultants, and academics;  
(v)  demonstrated  knowledge  and  understanding  of  ADB’s  communications, 
knowledge  dissemination,  and  knowledge  management  processes,  including 
working with its Department of External Relations is preferred;           
(vi)  excellent interpersonal and teamwork skills, demonstrated client orientation and 
sensitized in working in a diverse and multicultural environment; 
(vii)  excellent command of the English language; and  
(viii)  experience working in ADB’s DMCs is preferred. 
 
C.  National Consultants  
 
11.  Environment and Climate Change Law Expert and TA Project Manager (national, 3 
person-months, intermittent)  
 
12.  Scope of Work. The consultant will play a central role in the preparation and management 
of  TTT  in-person  trainings and  national  and/or  regional  in-person  and  e-roundtables  and 
strengthening of national and regional networks. The consultant will work with the knowledge 
partner and TA consultants in the design, production and delivery of in-person TTT programs, 
convening of the roundtables and design, production and delivery of knowledge products by 
providing environmental and/or climate change legal expertise and expert project management 
experience.  
 
13.  Detailed Tasks.  Under the supervision of ADB TA counsel, the consultant will provide 
expert project management and technical support and carry out the following tasks:  
 
(i)  assist in the design and delivery of in-person TTT training programs and national 
and regional roundtables and provide technical inputs and make presentations as 
necessary, in close coordination with the knowledge partner and TA consultants; 
(ii)  manage and liaise with relevant ADB departments, resident missions, DMCs, host 
institutions and other stakeholders on the delivery of the in-country TTT programs

5 
 
(iii)  coordinate  with  the  knowledge  partners  and  TA  consultants,  relevant  ADB 
departments,  resident  missions,  DMCs,  host  institutions  and  other  relevant 
stakeholder in the delivery of the in-person TTT programs and convening of the 
national and regional roundtables;  
(iv)  develop a filing system and database for easy monitoring of TA-related activities; 
(v)  provide timely inputs to ADB TA counsel for preparation of relevant reports and 
documents; and 
(vi)  perform other reasonably related tasks to achieve TA outputs and outcomes.  
 
18.  Qualifications. The Senior Project Coordinator must have: 
 
(i)  at least 10 years of experience in planning, coordinating and supporting the 
delivery of international training workshops and conferences in ADB’s DMCs; 
(ii)  good working knowledge and understanding of ADB’s policies and operations and 
TA projects is preferred; 
(iii)  demonstrated  ability  to  take  initiative  and  work  independently  with  limited 
supervision; 
(iv)  excellent  interpersonal  skills  and  experience  working  in  a  multicultural 
environment; and 
(v)  good oral and written communication skills in English. 
(vi)   
 
19.  Web, Multimedia and IT Consultant (national, 3 person-months, intermittent)  
 
20.   Scope  of  Work. The  consultant  will  be  responsible  for  enhancing,  managing  and 
maintaining the content, usability, and performance of the TA website (www.teachenvirolaw.asia), 
its  external  public  pages  and  secure  participant  section,  training  manual  and  e-learning 
courseware. This includes developing multimedia products and ensuring web designs and layouts 
that are usable and accessible in mobile devices.  
 
21.  Detailed Tasks. Under the supervision of ADB TA counsel, the Web, Multimedia and IT 
Consultant is expected to undertake the following tasks:   
 
(i)  manage and upload content on the TA website, including, participant profile 
information, event materials, teaching resources and other relevant information 
and documents;  
(ii)  monitor and provide usage reports and web analytics, solicit user feedback and 
make recommendations and implement improvements to the TTT website; 
(iii)  work closely with Knowledge Management and Communications Consultant in the 
design of the e-newsletters and other communications to the TTT participants and 
national and regional networks; 
(iv)  provide multimedia, web and IT support for in-person TTT programs and national 
and regional roundtables and other TA events;  
(v)  maintain the digital, video and photo library;  
(vi)  design and develop other web content as required; 
(vii)  resolve any website and social media related technical issues;  
(viii)  ensure coordination with the knowledge partner and other TA consultants; and 
(ix)  perform other reasonably related tasks to achieve TA outputs and outcomes.
